meanings.definition: A downward trend or decline in a situation or activity.
meanings.sent1: The company experienced a downspin in sales last quarter.
meanings.sent2: The economy is showing a downspin due to the recent recession.
meanings.sent3: The downspin in attendance at the party was noticeable, but we still had fun.
meanings.sent4: Her mood took a downspin after hearing the bad news.
meanings.sent5: The downspin in the team's performance was a cause for concern among the coaches.

meanings.definition: To undergo a decrease or decline in value or quality.
meanings.sent1: The stock market can downspin quickly during times of uncertainty.
meanings.sent2: I hope our project doesn't downspin after all the hard work we put into it.
meanings.sent3: His grades started to downspin after he stopped studying regularly.
meanings.sent4: The relationship began to downspin once they stopped communicating effectively.
meanings.sent5: The car's condition continued to downspin as it aged.
